items.title: Import maps go universal
items.content:
#â€‹632 â€” March 31, 2023

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

JavaScript Import Maps Now Supported Cross-Browser â€” ES modules provide a modern way to include and reuse JavaScript code in web apps, and import maps provide the bridge between using module names in code and where those modules can actually be loadedÂ from.

Thomas Steiner (Chrome Developers)

ğŸ The import map news comes off the back of the release of Safari 16.4 which introduces a lot of new functionality to the Mac-based browser, from Web Push and import maps to improved Web Component support and lazy-loading support for iframes.

Updates from the 95th TC39 Meeting â€” Working group meetings might not seem interesting on the surface, but a lot of what TC39 discusses ends up in our day to day code. Of special interest this time are the progression of support for ranges and the async context proposal to stage 2, and awaiting a dictionary of promises and decorators for class constructors/methods to stageÂ 1.

Hemanth HM

React Authentication, Simplified â€” In this article, we lay out a new approach to authentication (plus access control & SSO) in ReactÂ applications.

Userfront sponsor

React Labs: What React Core Has Been Working On â€” The latest update from the React core team. The most striking update comes around the progress of React Forget, an optimizing compiler with the goal being able to build fully reactive systems using the JavaScript and React mental models you already have, with the compiler tackling the trickiestÂ parts.

The React Core Team

IN BRIEF:

  • Over on Twitter, ğŸ¦ Stefan Judis notes that Firefox Nightly is the first browser shipping support for @media (scripting: none) to detect disabled JavaScript in CSS.

  • ğŸ—‘ Over half of new npm packages are junk. Though that's an improvement on packages riddled with malware... Could we improve things by using ChatGPT to analyze packages? Maybe, says Socket.

  • ğŸ“… Excited about the future of Angular? Next Tuesday, the Angular team is doing a livestream on YouTube about the Angular Signals RFC.

  • Microsoft has 'rebuilt Teams from the ground up' with React replacing AngularJS at the heart of the UI.

  • Did you know SVG almost got built-in network socket support? ğŸ¤¨

  • The Cloudflare Workers edge serverless platform is based around V8 isolates rather than Node.js but is now gaining support for some Node.js APIs.

RELEASES:

  • Rome 12
    â†³ Big release for the linter & formatter.

  • Solid 1.7
    â†³ Flexible declarative library for UIs.

  • Visual Studio Code March 2023
    â†³ Now with improved switch scaffolding for TS/JS.

  • Ionic 7.0
    â†³ Powerful cross-platform mobile app toolkit.

  • Docusaurus 2.4
    â†³ React-powered docs site generator.

  • Node.js v16.20.0 (LTS)

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

Janet for Mortals â€” Janet is a Lisp-like functional dynamic language that can nonetheless be compiled and interact with C libraries. This online book about Janet targets folks who already know JavaScript inÂ particular.

Ian Henry

In Praise of Vite â€” â€œThe single best feature of Vite, as far as Iâ€™m concerned, is its simplicity. Compared to the nightmare of configuring WebPack and Babel? Vite is delightfully easy toÂ use.â€

Scott Vandehey

ğŸ’¡ Robin Wieruch has just published a tutorial on migrating to Vite from Create React App (CRA) if you want to give it a go forÂ yourself.

The Easiest Way to Add Chat to Your Application. Try Stream for Free â€” Build and ship real-time messaging in less time with our highly reliable chat infrastructure and feature-rich SDKs. Free 30-dayÂ trial.

Stream sponsor

Building Framer Motion Animations Inside a Qwik Application â€” Also touches on Motion One as a bonus, an animation library similar to Framer but lighter and faster toÂ use.

Yoav Ganbar

A Business Case for SvelteKit â€” A good post covering the experience of migrating from Meteor to SvelteKit, the process this team undertook, and the outcomes from both a performance and UX point ofÂ view.

Chris Ellis

How to Enable OpenTelemetry Traces in React Apps â€” A ten-step approach to enabling OpenTelemetry traces in React apps all the way through to viewing the end results inÂ Jaeger.

Purva Naik (Red Hat)

Build Developer-First Automations with Retool Workflows

Retool sponsor

Understanding module.exports and exports in Node
James Hibbard

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

NPKILL 0.11.1: Delete node_modules Even Faster â€” NPKILL (homepage) is a popular tool for listing node_modules folders and how much space they take up, before allowing you to quickly delete them. This new release makes it even faster than before through using workerÂ threads.

Gallardo and GÃ³mez

Inferno 8.1: A Fast, React-a-Like with a Different Approach â€” React-like, but you might be more intrigued by its differences (which include a different approach to optimizing performance and lifecycle events on functionalÂ components).

Inferno

Breakpoints and console.log Is the Past, Time Travel Is the Future â€” 15x faster JavaScript debugging than with breakpoints and console.log, supports Vitest, Jest, Karma, Jasmine, andÂ more.

Wallaby.js sponsor

Nano JSX: A Lightweight SSR-First JSX Library â€” Features include no Virtual DOM, no external dependencies, on-demand hydration, and support for Node and Deno-basedÂ server-side renderingÂ situations.

Nano JSX

Concurrent.js: Load Modules into Background Threads â€” For JS environments including the browser, Node and Deno, this library dynamically imports modules into worker threads (in Node) or Web Workers (in theÂ browser) to run them away from the mainÂ thread.

Bitair

cron-schedule 4.0: Cron Parser and Scheduler â€” Parse and query cron style expressions in the browser, Node orÂ Deno.

Pascal Sthamer

Bright: A React Server Component for Syntax Highlighting â€” Customizable and includes all of VS Codeâ€™s syntax highlighting themes, some of which are demonstrated on theÂ page.

Code Hike

typescript-json-serializer 6.0 â€” Deserialize JSON into TypeScript classes and serialize classes into JSON.

Gillian PÃ©rard

ğŸ’» Jobs

Full Stack JavaScript Engineer @ Emerging Cybersecurity Startup â€” Small team/big results. Fun + flexible + always interesting. Come build our award-winning, all-in-one cybersecurityÂ platform.
Defendify

Software Engineer â€” Join our happy team. Stimulus is a social platform started by Sticker Mule to show what's possible if your mission is to increase humanÂ happiness.
Stimulus

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Hired makes job hunting easy-instead of chasing recruiters, companies approach you with salary details up front. Create a free profileÂ now.
Hired

ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ’» Got a job listing to share? Here's how.

QUICK RELEASES:

  • Ink 4.1
    â†³ Use React to build interactive CLI apps.

  • Ember Simple Auth 5.0
    â†³ Authentication and authorization for Ember apps.

  • Cypress 12.9
    â†³ Browser-oriented testing framework.

  • SVGR 7.0
    â†³ Transform SVGs into React components.

  • ğŸ¹ JZZ 1.6.1
    â†³ MIDI library for Node and browsers.

  • Vue Sonner
    â†³ The Sonner toast component but for Vue.

  • np 7.7 â€“ A better npm publish.

  • Qwik 0.100 â€“ The HTML-first framework.

  • DOM Testing Library 9.2

  • React Date Picker 4.11

  • pnpm 8.1

items.title: Playwright now offers a UI mode
items.content:
#â€‹631 â€” March 24, 2023

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Speeding Up the JavaScript Ecosystem: npm Scripts â€” The latest in what has been a fascinating series on finding â€˜low hanging fruitâ€™ when it comes to performance in the JavaScript world. The author explains it best himself:

â€œâ€˜npm scriptsâ€™ are executed by JavaScript developers â€¦ all the time. Despite their high usage they are not particularly well optimized and add about 400ms of overhead. In this article we were able to bring that down to ~22ms.â€
What Marvin does here is a valuable skill for all developers to pick up, and you can enjoy more by going back to theÂ start.

Marvin Hagemeister

Playwright v1.32 â€“ Now with UI Mode â€” The popular Web testing and automation framework is taking more steps toward ground currently served by tools like Cypress by offering a â€˜UI modeâ€™ that lets you explore, run and debug tests in a UI environment, complete with watch mode. â–¶ï¸ This video provides a goodÂ introduction.

Microsoft

A Grid Component with All the Features & Great Performance â€” Try our powerful JS data grid component which lets you edit, sort, group and filter datasets with fantastic performance. Includes a TreeGrid, API docs and plenty of demos. Seamless integration with React, Angular & VueÂ apps.

Bryntum sponsor

Why We Added package.json Support to Deno â€” Deno shares some provenance with Node.js but till recently it hadn't focused on supporting Node features like npm modules. But with Node and npm compatibility beginning to improve, the team has faced questions about the runtimeâ€™s priorities. Ryan Dahl explains more about their thinkingÂ here.

Ryan Dahl

ğŸ“¢ In other Deno news, Deno 1.32 has been released with... improved package.json support, andÂ more.

How to Start a React Project in 2023 â€” There are lots of ways, but this well-regarded author explains the pros and cons of a few approaches, and gives you a few options targeting specific use cases you mightÂ have.

Robin Wieruch

IN BRIEF:

  • GitHub had to update its RSA SSH host key today so you may see security related warnings when pushing and cloning. It's easy to fix, but check the new fingerprint matches â€“ it's for your ownÂ security.

  • The New Stack caught up with Svelte's Rich Harris on SvelteKit and what's coming for Svelte 4.

  • The React team shared some cutting edge updates on what they're working on including React Server Components and an optimizingÂ compiler.

  • If you were experiencing errors on the official Node site last week, here's the (detailed) post mortem of why. Config errors and inappropriate caching,Â mostly.

  • âœ¨ Did you know there's a market in fake GitHub stars? Some developers analyzed some repos to learn more aboutÂ it.

  • ğŸ¥‡ Congratulations to Lea Verou on her TC39 appointment. Her efforts to push the Web forward are legendary. Prism is one project you may be awareÂ of.

  • Make your opinions known on what should be in the next version ofÂ Vite.

RELEASES:

  • Docusaurus 2.4
    â†³ Easy to maintain documentation site generator.

  • Puppeteer 19.8
    â†³ Headless Chrome Node.js API.

  • Neutralinojs 4.11
    â†³ Lightweight cross-platform desktop app framework.

  • Qwik 0.23

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

Buying a Hard-to-Get Bicycle using Playwright â€” An unusual use case for JavaScript, Playwright, and GitHub Actions, but Maciek managed to buy hisÂ bike.

Maciek Palmowski

Snyk Top 10: JavaScript OSS Vulnerabilities â€” Dive into the most prevalent critical and high open source vulnerabilities found by Snyk scans of JavaScript apps inÂ 2022.

Snyk sponsor

The 'End' of Front-End Development? â€” A recent narrative doing the rounds suggests that large language models like GPT-4 (or even tools like Copilot X) could soon put some developers out of a job â€”Â however, Josh is â€œoptimistic about what these AI advancements mean for the future of softwareÂ developmentâ€.

Josh W. Comeau

In related news, Eric Elliott put ChatGPT through its paces to see if it would make for a good JavaScript tutor. It did well â€” though with mixed results.

Migrating from ts-node to Bun â€” A look at adopting performance-oriented Bun when you're used to using TypeScript with Node.js. John runs us through porting a console app from the ts-node approach over to Bun â€” â€œa pretty easyÂ process,â€ he says.

John Reilly

â–¶Â Â A Pinia Crash Course for Beginners â€” Pinia is a store / state management solution for Vue that does believe in pineapple onÂ pizza.

Alexander Gekov

A Practical Guide to Getting Started with Astro â€” An extensive walkthrough of Astro that covers all the topics youâ€™ll need to get youÂ started.

Mojtaba Seyedi

ğŸš€ Test Website Speed Continuously and Rank Higher In Google â€” You need a fast website to make users happy and meet Googleâ€™s Core Web Vitals metrics. Test and optimize withÂ DebugBear.

DebugBear sponsor

Automatic npm Publishing with GitHub Actions and GranularÂ Tokens
Tim Perry

Make Sure You Do This Before Switching to Signals in Angular
Jordan Powell

Six CSS Snippets Every Developer Should Know
Adam Argyle (Google)

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

trace.cafe: Easy Webperf Trace Sharing â€” A quick way to share a performance profile saved from your DevTools, available for up to 90 days with the DevTools perf panel embedded (seeÂ example).

paul irish

VueUse: A Collection of Vue Composition Utilities â€” With over 200 functions targeting both Vue 2 and 3, thereâ€™ll be something in this suite of Composition API-based utility functions for you, whether itâ€™s working with state, browser capabilities, animations, Electron, Firebase, andÂ more.

Anthony Fu

Donâ€™t Let Your Issue Tracker Be a Four-Letter Word. Use Shortcut

Shortcut (formerly Clubhouse.io) sponsor

OTPAuth: One Time Password (HOTP/TOTP) Library â€” When you log in to a site that uses 2FA and youâ€™re asked for some digits from an authentication app, thatâ€™s probably a Time-based One-Time Password (or TOTP). This library for Node, Deno, Bun and the browser lets you work with TOTPs and HOTPs fromÂ JS.

HÃ©ctor Molinero FernÃ¡ndez

Recharts 2.5: Chart Library Built with React and D3 â€” Easy to deploy with declarative components, native SVG support, and lightweight dependency on D3. Line, bar, scatter, composed, pie, and radar charts are offered. There are lots of examples, complete withÂ code.

recharts

DOCX 8.0: Generate Word .docx Files from JavaScript â€” The code to lay out documents is verbose but thereâ€™s a lot of functionality. Hereâ€™s a CodePen example and release notes â€“ GitHubÂ repo.

Dolan Miu

SvHighlight: Code Syntax Highlighter for Svelte â€” Powered by Highlight.js, it includes a blurring feature to focus attention on specific areas of code and you an customize it with Tailwind. Try the interactive examples to see theÂ effect.

SvHighlight

eslint-formatter-pretty 5.0: Pretty ESLint Formatter â€” Nicer output than the default. Sort results by severity. Get stylized inline code blocks, andÂ more.

Sindre Sorhus

AWS JWT Verify: Verify JWTs Signed by Amazon Cognito â€” In both Node.js and theÂ browser.

Amazon Web Services

ğŸ’» Jobs

Software Engineer (Backend) â€” Join our "kick ass" team. Our software team operates from 17 countries and we're always looking for more exceptionalÂ engineers.
Sticker Mule

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Hired makes job hunting easy-instead of chasing recruiters, companies approach you with salary details up front. Create a free profileÂ now.
Hired

ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ’» Got a job listing to share? Here's how.

  • melonJS 15.0
    â†³ Mature HTML5 game engine.

  • Marked 4.3
    â†³ Markdown parser and compiler. (Demo.)

  • v8go 0.9
    â†³ Execute JavaScript from Go(lang).

  • Million 2.1
    â†³ Fast Virtual DOM to make React faster.

  • Partytown 0.7.6
    â†³ Take third-party scripts off the main thread.

ğŸÂ Bonus Item

Make Bookmarklets â€” Create and test bookmarklets directly in the browser. Makes an irritating task slightly easier if you need to doÂ it.

Cullan Luther

SvHighlight: Code Syntax Highlighter for Svelte â€” Powered by Highlight.js, it includes a blurring feature to focus attention on specific areas of code and you an customize it with Tailwind. Try the interactive examples to see theÂ effect.
SvHighlight 


  
  
eslint-formatter-pretty 5.0: Pretty ESLint Formatter â€” Nicer output than the default. Sort results by severity. Get stylized inline code blocks, andÂ more.
Sindre Sorhus 


  
  
AWS JWT Verify: Verify JWTs Signed by Amazon Cognito â€” In both Node.js and theÂ browser.
Amazon Web Services 








ğŸ’» Jobs





  
Software Engineer (Backend) â€” Join our "kick ass" team. Our software team operates from 17 countries and we're always looking for more exceptionalÂ engineers.
  
Sticker Mule 
  


  
Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Hired makes job hunting easy-instead of chasing recruiters, companies approach you with salary details up front. Create a free profileÂ now.
  
Hired 
  


ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ’» Got a job listing to share? Here's how.














melonJS 15.0
Marked 4.3
Demo.)
v8go 0.9
Million 2.1
Partytown 0.7.6


ğŸÂ Bonus Item




  





  
  
Make Bookmarklets â€” Create and test bookmarklets directly in the browser. Makes an irritating task slightly easier if you need to doÂ it.
Cullan Luther

items.title: Transformers: JavaScript in Disguise
items.content:
#â€‹630 â€” March 17, 2023

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

ğŸ¤– Â Transformers.js: Running ML Models in the Browser â€” Transformers are a type of machine learning model often used for natural language or visual processing and while running such models directly in the browser is in its infancy, Transformers.js opens up some ML models to you with some impressive demosÂ here.

Xenova

ğŸ‰ Â Celebrating 10 Years of Electron â€” It feels like Electron pops up everywhere (Slack, Spotify, VS Code, and more) so it might feel surprising itâ€™s only been with us for a decade. Slack and Electron developer Erick Zhao gives thanks to Electronâ€™s developers, the community, gives us a bit of Electron related history, and reassures us Electron is still goingÂ strong.

Erick Zhao

Dynaboard: A Visual Web App IDE Made for Developers â€” Build high performance public and private web applications in a collaborative â€” full-stack â€” developmentÂ environment.

Dynaboard sponsor

Announcing TypeScript 5.0 â€” Note that TypeScript doesnâ€™t follow semantic versioning, so this is as much a â€˜majorâ€™ release as 4.9 was.. but 5.0 looks cool anyway. This release of the typed JavaScript superset is packed with features like decorators, improved ESM project support for Node and bundlers, const type parameters, andÂ more.

Daniel Rosenwasser (Microsoft)

Turbowatch: File Change Detector and Task Orchestrator â€” Not just that but it claims to be extremely fast and â€œif you ever wanted something like Nodemon but more capable, then you are at the right place.â€ This looks very promising and the README is full ofÂ examples.

Gajus Kuizinas

IN BRIEF:

  • BREAKING NEWS: The JS Party podcast has just dropped an episode called â–¶ï¸Â TheÂ Future of React â€“ so new, we haven't listened to it, but it features Dan Abramov and Joe Savona so may make for good weekend listening..

  • "The most dangerous command you run every day: npm install" says Socket, who are introducing what they call 'safe npm', a transparent wrapper around npm designed to, well, make it less dangerous.

  • CORRECTION: In issue 627 we suggested the ECMAScript 2023 spec had entered a new draft stage. TC39 member Jordan Harband pointed out to us that it has been in such a state for some time. "There's still a stage 4 PR not yet merged," he noted, but there will be some progress in the next month.

  • Defer is a new 'zero-infrastructure' background jobs platform for Node.js apps.

  • Recently we linked to ğŸµ Dittytoy, a fun online JavaScript environment for audio coding/experiments. Someone has somehow implemented an entire Commodore 64 SID synthesizer in it!

ğŸ“… Â Developer Day: A Front-Row Seat to What's New with Retool

Retool sponsor

RELEASES:

  • Node.js v19.8.0/1 (Current)

  • Jasmine 4.6
    â†³ Testing framework for browsers and Node.

  • pm2 5.3
    â†³ Popular Node production process manager.

  • Mongoose 7.0
    â†³ Popular MongoDB ODM for Node.js.

  • ESLint 8.36

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

Chrome 111 Gains a 'View Transition' Feature for SPAs â€” The View Transition API is only supported by Chrome so far, but allows easy animated page transitions within single-page apps (demo here). Luckily it suits progressive enhancement so you can start using it right now without feeling too guilty ;-) Multi-page app support isÂ forthcoming.

Jake Archibald (Chrome Developers)

Create and Download Text Files with JavaScript â€” If you want your code to be able to generate a text (such as JSON) file on the fly and have it downloaded by the userâ€™s browser, itâ€™s reasonablyÂ easy.

Amit Merchant

Five Mistakes I Made When Starting My First React Project â€” Richard shares his early React mistakes with the hope you can learn from his misfortunes. He tackles topics like using defaultProps, propTypes, and classÂ components.

Richard Oliver Bray

Too Much Tech Debt in Your node_modules? Our Team of JS Devs CanÂ Help â€” We are a team of senior software engineers who specialize in tech debt. Let us modernize your JavaScript stackÂ ğŸš€

UpgradeJS.com | JavaScript Upgrade Services sponsor

Progressively Enhancing a Table with a Web Component â€” Building a web component wrapper to add tableÂ sorting.

Raymond Camden

Shell-Free Node.js Scripting with Execa 7.1 â€” Execa is a popular process execution library for Node and the latest version includes an interesting $ method feature for writing zx-style scripts with it, making it even more useful for shell scripting styleÂ usecases.

ehmicky

What is Vite and Why Use It Over Create React App?
Luke Twomey

Pointers on Upgrading from Cypress v9 to v12
Gleb Bahmutov

How to Use v-model with Form Inputs in Vue
Dmitri Pavlutin

How to Create and Use Path Aliases in TypeScript Imports with Vite
Hasibul Hasan

What Is Deno and How to Use Its Sandbox?
Roman Zaynetdinov

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

Template: A Simple Framework for Webapps â€” The author built it for his own projects, but notes: â€œItâ€™s a joy to work in, feels â€œframeworkyâ€ but itâ€™s just web standards with <100 lines of convenience JS wrapped around it. There is no magic beyond what the browser provides - I like it thatÂ way.â€ We doÂ too.

William Blankenship

React ProseMirror: Integrate the ProseMirror Editor with React â€” ProseMirror is a toolkit for building rich text editors for theÂ Web.

The New York Times

Breakpoints and console.log Is the Past, Time Travel Is theÂ Future â€” 15x faster JavaScript debugging than with breakpoints and console.log, now with support forÂ Vitest.

Wallaby.js sponsor

Fable 4.0: F# to JavaScript Compiler â€” If you fancy F#â€™s flavor of almost-entirely-functional development, this could be for you. GitHubÂ repo.

Fable

MiniSearch: Small In-Memory Fulltext Search Engine for Browser andÂ Node â€” The strength is that the indexed data is stored locally, allowing it to work offline and giving goodÂ performance, as seen in thisÂ demo.

Luca Ongaro

css-variable: Tiny Treeshakable Library to Define CSS Custom Properties in JS â€” Compatible with popular CSS-in-JS libraries like Emotion, styled-components, Linaria, etc., and it boasts better CSS minification and smaller virtual DOM updates, among otherÂ features.

Jan Nicklas

Tremor 2.0: The React Library to Build Dashboards Fast â€” Provides an array of modular components to build data-driven dashboards. v2.0 is the â€œfirst step towards a production-ready version of Tremorâ€ and sees a full switch to Tailwind CSS. Homepage.

Tremor Labs

Stable Diffusion Plugin for Photoshop â€” Writing code that worked with Adobeâ€™s weird JS variant was ghastly, but this uses their new 'UXP' based approach, so is interesting enough for that alone. This plugin also opens up the Stable Diffusion generative art system to PhotoshopÂ users.

Abdullah Alfaraj

Flexboard: A React Component Library for Resizable Sidebars â€” Try the live example. The code allows you to set min/max sizes for the resizable parts of theÂ layout.

Dorbus

ğŸ’» Jobs

Full Stack JavaScript Engineer @ Emerging Cybersecurity Startup â€” Small team/big results. Fun + flexible + always interesting. Come build our award-winning, all-in-one cybersecurityÂ platform.
Defendify

Software Engineer (Frontend) â€” Join our "kick ass" team. Our software team operates from 17 countries and we're always looking for more exceptionalÂ engineers.
Sticker Mule

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Hired makes job hunting easy-instead of chasing recruiters, companies approach you with salary details up front. Create a free profileÂ now.
Hired

ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ’» Got a job listing to share? Here's how.

  • Fuite 2.0
    â†³ Tool for finding memory leaks in web apps.

  • ğŸ¼ wavesurfer.js 6.6
    â†³ Navigable waveform built on Web Audio & canvas.

  • Svelte-Inview 4.0
    â†³ Svelte action that monitors when an element enters/leaves the viewport.

  • Discord.js 14.8
    â†³ Library for using the Discord chat API.

  • Plotly.js 2.20
    â†³ Powerful charting library. (Examples.)

  • Recharts 2.5
    â†³ React + D3 charting library. (Examples.)

  • deepmerge 4.3.1
    â†³ Merges the enumerable properties of objects.

  • Vue Testing Library 7.0

  • React Table Library 4.1

items.title: New JavaScript features of the past few years
items.content:
#â€‹629 â€” March 10, 2023

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

JavaScript Features from the PastÂ FewÂ Years â€” Packed with examples, this post tackles the changes and tweaks to JavaScript and TypeScript over the past several years (some as far back as ES6/ES2015, like tagged template literals).

Linus Schlumberger

Astro's 2023 Web Framework Performance Report â€” The folks working on Astro looked at data from thousands of sites to understand how sites built around Astro, Gatsby, Next.js, Nuxt, Remix, SvelteKit and WordPress perform on common Web performance metrics. Shipping less JS equals moreÂ performance.

Fred Schott (Astro)

In other Astro related news, Astro 2.1 has just been released with experimental automatic image optimization support, plus they've visually rebranded the project.

A Fresh Introduction to NextÂ 13+ â€” Learn Next.js, the complete full-stack framework to create basic blog websites up to full-blown apps and APIs! Plus if you are already familiar with Next.js, we have a course building a full app on NextÂ 13+.

Frontend Masters sponsor

TypeScript's Migration to Modules â€” TypeScript has restructured its codebase to use ES modules. For this, we get smaller package sizes, quicker build times, and little disruption to end users. A CommonJS API is provided for now so that build scripts don't break. This post goes deep in to what the moveÂ entailed.

Daniel Rosenwasser and Jake Bailey

IN BRIEF:

  • A quick look at the 12 most popular Node.js frameworks, as of 2023. Don't feel left out if you prefer Deno, there's a roundup of Deno frameworks, too.

  • Jest 29.5 has added a feature to randomize the order in which tests are run â€“ why? Your tests should be isolated and not depend upon each other â€“ this will unearth any problems.

  • Three things are certain: death, taxes, and jQuery. Still the most heavily deployed JS library, jQuery 3.6.4 has been released with a reversion to how it determines browser support for CSS selection features.

  • ğŸ“… UtahJS Conf 2023 is taking place in September, and their call for speakers is open till April 3.

  • ğŸ”’ A neat approach to creating a static, password protected page withÂ AESâ€‘256.

  • The folks at Moddable went to FOSDEM to make the case for using JavaScript in embedded systems.

RELEASES:

  • TestCafe 2.4 â€“ E2E web testing tool now with a visual selectorÂ debugger.

  • SWR 2.1 â€“ React hooks for data fetching. Now with subscription mode.

  • Mantine 6.0
    â†³ 100+ React component library.

  • Node.js 18.15.0 (LTS)

  • Ember.js 4.11

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

Common Beginner Mistakes with React â€” Experienced React educator Josh has seen all the problems people encounter and here he digs into â€œ9 of the most dastardly gotchasâ€ and how to resolveÂ them.

Josh W Comeau

â–¶Â Â Coding Kenta Toshikuraâ€™s Glass Effect with Three.js â€” Yet more creative noodling with Three.js and shaders that goes over myÂ head.

Yuri Artiukh

React Authentication, Simplified â€” In this article, we lay out a new approach to authentication (plus access control & SSO) in ReactÂ applications.

Userfront sponsor

How to Change the Favicon When Switching Browser Tabs â€” Originally inspired by Astro, you can see the concept at work on notepad.js.org

Amit Merchant

â–¶Â Â Progressive Web Apps (PWA) forÂ Beginners â€” Beginner-focused series on building PWAs, covering their capabilities, pros and cons, and more over 17Â videos.

Microsoft Developer

How to Make Slow React Native AppsÂ Faster â€” The folks over at Retool recently released an app to build native apps in a similar way to Web-based ones. This post covers a few optimizations they made to make it appÂ faster.

James Lee (Retool)

Full-Stack TypeScript with tRPC and React â€” How to create a CRUD app with Express on the server and React on the client using tRPC to communicate between theÂ two.

Robin Wieruch

Building an Image Recognition App with Pinecone, Hugging Face, and Vercel
Roie Schwaber-Cohen

Using Zod and TypeScript for More Than User InputÂ Validation
Sebastien Castiel

Building Complex Forms in Vue
Olufunke Moronfolu

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

HuggingFace.js: Use Lots of ML Models from JavaScript â€” Hugging Face is a popular online community and repository of machine learning models. The goal of this library is to open up those models more easily toÂ JavaScript.

Hugging Face

Dynaboard: A Visual Web App IDE Made for Developers â€” Build high performance public and private web applications in a collaborative â€” full-stack â€” developmentÂ environment.

Dynaboard sponsor

Chrono: A Natural Language Date Parser â€” Give it a string like â€œtodayâ€, â€œlast Fridayâ€, â€œ2 weeks from nowâ€, or even an entire date and time, and itâ€™ll come up with a date object toÂ suit.

Wanasit Tanakitrungruang

Embetty 4.0: A Privacy-Conscious Way to Show Third Party Embeds â€” Tweets, and Facebook, Video or YouTube thumbnails (see demo here.) The privacy comes from using a proxy server you hostÂ yourself.

heise online

Finder 3.0: CSS Selector Generator â€” Given an element, it produces the shortest possible selector that reaches (solely) thatÂ element.

Anton Medvedev

Tuple, a Lightning-Fast Pairing Tool Built for Remote Developers

Tuple sponsor

Feathers 5: Node.js API & Real-Time App Framework â€” Feathers is a great option if you want to spin up a CRUD app tied to a database and now itâ€™s â€œTypeScript all the way downâ€ too (you can choose to use JS, as you prefer). Leap into the quick start guide to see what itâ€™sÂ about.

David Luecke

FormKit: The Open-Source Form Framework for Vue â€” Ships with production-ready scaffolding like inputs, forms, submission and error handling, and validationÂ rules.

FormKit, Inc.

ğŸ’» Jobs

Software Engineer â€” Join our happy team. Stimulus is a social platform started by Sticker Mule to show what's possible if your mission is to increase humanÂ happiness.
Stimulus

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Hired makes job hunting easy-instead of chasing recruiters, companies approach you with salary details up front. Create a free profileÂ now.
Hired

ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ’» Got a job listing to share? Here's how.

  • ClearScript 7.4
    â†³ MS library to add JS scripting to .NET apps.

  • Million 2.0
    â†³ Fast virtual DOM that makes React faster.

  • Video.js 8.2
    â†³ Flexible media player control.

  • Embla Carousel 7.1
    â†³ Smooth carousel library. (Examples.)

  • Deck.gl 8.9
    â†³ WebGL2-powered data viz framework.

  • MUI X 6.0
    â†³ Suite of advanced React UI components.

  • ReacType 14.0
    â†³ Rapid React prototyping tool.

  • Lebab 3.1.2
    â†³ Turn ES5 into ES6. It's Babel backwards!

  • Rimraf 4.4
    â†³ Cross platform rm -rf for Node.js.

ğŸ˜Â A Bonus Item

Ink 4.0: Use the React Approach for Building Interactive CLIÂ Apps â€” Build your command line apps using React-style components. As of v4.0, Ink is now pure ESM, requires React 18, and requires NodeÂ 14.16+.

Vadim Demedes
